title: Hello!
text:
Welcome to my webpage! ^_^
I’m Yee Ching, a Communications and New Media student studying at the National University of Singapore!
As someone who loves to express myself in creative ways, be it in written or visual forms, I’m keen to explore a career in the communications and marketing industry.
Beyond my career aspirations, in my free time, you’ll probably catch me doodling away on my iPad, playing with my terrapin, watching shows, or napping away…zzz.

title: Project Diary
text:
As an avid K-Drama watcher, I felt compelled to explore the topic of Korean Dramas, also known as K-Dramas, and answer the question of, What makes K-Drama popular?.
Through a factors-type data-story, I will explain the popularity of K-Dramas by analysing and showcasing the specific factors that have contributed to its popularity.





K-Drama’s degree of popularity worldwide as of December 2022: https://www.statista.com/statistics/999239/south-korea-korean-drama-popularity-worldwide/

1.1 America 2019: https://www-statista-com.libproxy1.nus.edu.sg/statistics/1017862/south-korea-korean-drama-popularity-us/
1.2 Japan 2019: https://www-statista-com.libproxy1.nus.edu.sg/statistics/1017819/south-korea-korean-drama-popularity-japan/
1.3 Thailand 2019: https://www-statista-com.libproxy1.nus.edu.sg/statistics/1017828/south-korea-korean-drama-popularity-thailand/
1.4 China 2019: https://www-statista-com.libproxy1.nus.edu.sg/statistics/1017829/south-korea-korean-drama-popularity-china/
1.5 Russia 2019: https://www-statista-com.libproxy1.nus.edu.sg/statistics/1017888/south-korea-korean-drama-popularity-russia/

Top 100 K-Dramas users have ranked on MyDramaList, featuring variables like Name, Year of Release, Aired Date, Aired On, Number of Episode, Network, Duration, Content Rating, Synopsis, Cast, Genre, Tags, Rank, Rating: https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/chanoncharuchinda/top-100-korean-drama-mydramalist
Information about dramas (Drama Name, Year, Synopsis, Genres, Tags, Director, Screen writer, Country ect) and user reviews (Ratings on the story, Acting cast, Music, Rewatch Value, Overall, Number of episodes watched etc) from Korea, Japan, and Thailand: https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/chanoncharuchinda/thai-and-japanese-drama-vs-korean-drama-dominance?select=kor_user_reviews.csv
Top 5000 Asian Dramas from Korea, Japan, China, Taiwan, and Thailand, featuring variables like Name, Episodes, Released Year, Language, Rating, Ranking: https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/lakshmiindukosuri/top-5000-dramas-1983-2023
Popular over the top media services for accessing K-Dramas worldwide in 2022: https://www-statista-com.libproxy1.nus.edu.sg/statistics/999315/south-korea-ott-services-for-accessing-korean-dramas-worldwide/

title: Week 8 Project Submission
text: 2. Data Sources Curated So Far

title: Final Project
text:
Have you ever wondered why almost everyone around you watches, or at least knows the names of some K-Dramas? If so…
Hello and welcome to my data story! :)
As an avid K-Drama watcher, I thought it would be interesting to investigate and showcase the driving factors of:
Why are K-Dramas so popular globally?

title: Project Diary
text:
1. Finalised Topic
As an avid K-Drama watcher, I felt compelled to explore the topic of Korean Dramas, also known as K-Dramas.
Through a factors-type data-story, I will explain the popularity of K-Dramas by analysing and showcasing the specific factors that have contributed to its popularity.

title: Project Diary
text:
2. Identified Datasets

K-Drama’s degree of popularity worldwide as of December 2022: https://www.statista.com/statistics/999239/south-korea-korean-drama-popularity-worldwide/

1.1 America 2019: https://www-statista-com.libproxy1.nus.edu.sg/statistics/1017862/south-korea-korean-drama-popularity-us/
1.2 Japan 2019: https://www-statista-com.libproxy1.nus.edu.sg/statistics/1017819/south-korea-korean-drama-popularity-japan/
1.3 Thailand 2019: https://www-statista-com.libproxy1.nus.edu.sg/statistics/1017828/south-korea-korean-drama-popularity-thailand/
1.4 China 2019: https://www-statista-com.libproxy1.nus.edu.sg/statistics/1017829/south-korea-korean-drama-popularity-china/
1.5 Russia 2019: https://www-statista-com.libproxy1.nus.edu.sg/statistics/1017888/south-korea-korean-drama-popularity-russia/

Top 100 K-Dramas users have ranked on MyDramaList, featuring variables like Name, Year of Release, Aired Date, Aired On, Number of Episode, Network, Duration, Content Rating, Synopsis, Cast, Genre, Tags, Rank, Rating: https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/chanoncharuchinda/top-100-korean-drama-mydramalist
Information about dramas (Drama Name, Year, Synopsis, Genres, Tags, Director, Screen writer, Country ect) and user reviews (Ratings on the story, Acting cast, Music, Rewatch Value, Overall, Number of episodes watched etc) from Korea, Japan, and Thailand: https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/chanoncharuchinda/thai-and-japanese-drama-vs-korean-drama-dominance?select=kor_user_reviews.csv
Top 5000 Asian Dramas from Korea, Japan, China, Taiwan, and Thailand, featuring variables like Name, Episodes, Released Year, Language, Rating, Ranking: https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/lakshmiindukosuri/top-5000-dramas-1983-2023
Popular over the top media services for accessing K-Dramas worldwide in 2022: https://www-statista-com.libproxy1.nus.edu.sg/statistics/999315/south-korea-ott-services-for-accessing-korean-dramas-worldwide/

title: Project Diary
section: 1. Question I am going to answer:
text:
1. Question I am going to answer:
What makes K-Dramas so popular globally?

title: Project Diary
section: 2. Why is this an important question?
text:
2. Why is this an important question?

Governments can understand how to use its entertainment industry to expand its soft power like South Korea, evident in how K-Dramas have become a global culture phenomenon with immense international viewership, according to Statista’s 2022 findings that 66% of respondents surveyed across 26 countries felt that K-Dramas were popular outside of dedicated fan circles. https://www.statista.com/statistics/999239/south-korea-korean-drama-popularity-worldwide/
Policymakers can learn content and media strategies, and apply them to their own countries’ entertainment industry to achieve economic gains just like South Korea, where according to the Ministry of Science and ICT and the Korea Communications Commission, $561.3 million worth of Korean Television content was sold abroad in 2022, demonstrating K-Dramas’ capability of generating substantial financial gains for the South Korean economy. https://www.koreaherald.com/view.php?ud=20231225000165
It prompts us to consider how we can use K-Dramas to widen outreach to support individuals with mental health issues given K-Dramas’ immense potential as a social marketing tool to educate communities on mental health and school bullying, according to the National Library of Medicine. https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC7084599/

title: Project Diary
section: 3. Which rows and columns of the dataset will be used to answer this question?
text:
3. Which rows and columns of the dataset will be used to answer this question?
As there are bits of information I want to use across different datasets, I will be using several datasets to get a deeper understanding of K-Dramas, and a broader understanding of K-Dramas as compared to Thailand and Japanese Dramas.
Data Sources on K-Dramas only:
From this dataset: https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/chanoncharuchinda/top-100-korean-drama-mydramalist

Rows: 2 to 101
Columns: Name, Aired On, Number of Episode, Network, Duration, Cast, Genre, Tags, Rank, Rating

From this dataset: kor_user_review https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/chanoncharuchinda/thai-and-japanese-drama-vs-korean-drama-dominance?select=kor_user_reviews.csv

Rows: 2 to 16790
Columns: title, story, acting_cast, music, rewatch_value, overall, text, ep_watched

From this dataset: kor_kor_actors https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/chanoncharuchinda/thai-and-japanese-drama-vs-korean-drama-dominance?select=kor_user_reviews.csv

Rows: 2 to 8752
Columns: actor_name, drama_name

From this dataset: kor_drama https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/chanoncharuchinda/thai-and-japanese-drama-vs-korean-drama-dominance?select=kor_user_reviews.csv

Rows: 2 to 1774
Columns: drama_name, year, genres, tags, tot_eps, org_net, tot_user_score, tot_num_user, rank, popularity

Data Sources for Comparison across region:
From this dataset: top_5000_drama https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/lakshmiindukosuri/top-5000-dramas-1983-2023

Rows: 2 to 5001
Columns: Name, Language, Rating, Ranking, Episodes, Released Year
Filter out dramas which are released before 2015 since I am looking at the range of 2015-2023

From this dataset: tha_drama https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/chanoncharuchinda/thai-and-japanese-drama-vs-korean-drama-dominance?select=kor_user_reviews.csv

Rows: 2 to 1532
Columns: drama_name, year, genres, tags, tot_eps, org_net, tot_user_score, tot_num_user, rank, popularity

From this dataset: jap_drama https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/chanoncharuchinda/thai-and-japanese-drama-vs-korean-drama-dominance?select=kor_user_reviews.csv

Rows: 2 to 2139
Columns: drama_name, year, genres, tags, tot_eps, org_net, tot_user_score, total_num_user, rank, popularity

title: Project Diary
section: 4. Challenges and How I Overcame Them
text:
4. Challenges and How I Overcame Them
Given the many datasets I have, I was unsure if I should include certain datasets on Thai and Japanese dramas and their respective user reviews and actor information, as they are not directly related to the question. I eventually decided to only select information that would be useful for a more comprehensive analysis and comparison across different cultural contexts – basic information like the name, year the drama was released, genres, tags, total number of episodes, and other ranking and reviews from users.
If I realise I require additional information for comparison in the future, I will include more information on user reviews on Thai and Japanese dramas. Similarly, if I realise the amount of data I have now is excessive and unnecessary to investigate the factors behind the popularity of K-Dramas globally, I will remove these datasets on Thai and Japanese Dramas

title: Final Project
text: Insights and Recommendations

title: Final Project
section: 1. K-Dramas Generally Have The Highest Ratings
text:
1. K-Dramas Generally Have The Highest Ratings
Ratings are an essential metric in evaluating the success and popularity of dramas, providing valuable insight into audience reception and their preferences.
Generally, the higher or more positive ratings a drama receives, be it quantitatively or qualitatively, the greater its appeal and impact on viewers.









Interquartile Range (IQR)
When we look at the IQR of all 3 boxplots, the ratings for K-Drama seem to have the greatest dispersion of 0.7, compared to Japanese with 0.6, and Thai with 0.5.
The larger IQR may reflect differences in the quality of K-dramas. Some K-dramas may receive very high ratings from a segment of viewers, while others receive lower ratings from a different segment, resulting in a broader range of ratings.
Median
However, despite this, K-Dramas still enjoy the highest average ratings.
Comparing the medians, or average ratings, of Japanese, Thai, and Korean dramas from 2018 to 2023, it seems that it is a close fight among all 3 languages. Each are doing relatively well in the market with high ratings in the 7 points region (out of 10).
However, K-Dramas ultimately emerge as the frontrunner with an average rating of 7.80, with Japanese dramas following closely behind with an average rating of 7.70, and lastly, Thai dramas with a nonetheless commendable average rating of 7.60.
This shows that while each language’s dramas have their own unique charm that garner them a significant fan base and presence, K-Dramas stand out, appealing to and resonating with the audiences the most.
Maximum
Moreover, K-Dramas evidently have the highest peak rating of 9.20, compared to Japanese’s 8.80, and Thai’s 8.70, reinforcing K-Drama’s dominance and immense appeal to audiences that led to exceptionally high ratings.
If this dosen’t sound impressive enough, wait till we look at how K-Drama ratings have progressed across time, particularly in the form of concrete scores that users give!









Let’s split the time period of 2018 to 2023 to 3 smaller periods - pre-COVID years (2018 to 2019), COVID years (2020 to 2021), and post-COVID years (2022 to 2023).
In the pre-COVID years, K-Dramas maintained a competitive edge over Thai and Japanese dramas with higher user scores around 7.6. However, during the COVID years, K-Dramas experienced a significant dip to the 7.5 points region - the lowest it has ever been, as compared to Japanese dramas which rose steadily.
Yet in a turn of events, in the post-COVID years, the average user scores of K-Dramas abruptly picked up in 2021 and rose exponentially to a record high of 7.81 in 2023, maintaining an increasing upward trend from 2021 to 2023. Meanwhile, the average user scores for both Thai and Japanese dramas generally dipped to the 7.4 and 7.5 points region respectively by 2023, demonstrating a falling trend.
This could be attributed to the release of the Korean survival series drama, Squid Game, on 17 September 2021, which exploded on the international scene. In fact, Squid Game was crowned as Netflix’s most-watched non-English series, with a staggering amount of 2,205,200,000 hours viewed as of March 31, 2024 (Netflix, n.d.), and one of the most popular K-Dramas internationally as of December 2022 (Statista, 2023a).



Squid Game | source: Netflix


It is likely that Squid Game’s widespread popularity catapulted K-Dramas into the global spotlight, attracting new international audiences and interest. This recognition of Squid Game also likely prompted increased investment into Korean content from producers and streaming platforms in light of the rising viewership and interest from audiences from all over the world, solidifying its dominance in the market and entertainment industry.

title: Final Project
text:
References
Escandon, R. (2020, March 12). The film industry made a record-breaking $100 billion last year. Forbes. https://www.forbes.com/sites/rosaescandon/2020/03/12/the-film-industry-made-a-record-breaking-100-billion-last-year/?sh=5b3657bb34cd
Netflix. (n.d.). Netflix top 10 - global. Www.netflix.com. https://www.netflix.com/tudum/top10/most-popular/tv-non-english
Statista. (2023a, July 15). South Korea: Leading South Korean dramas abroad 2022. Statista. https://www.statista.com/statistics/1266541/south-korea-leading-south-korean-dramas-abroad/
Statista. (2023b, December 22). South Korea: Export value of k-dramas by type of broadcast 2020. Statista; Statista Research Department. https://www.statista.com/statistics/1274248/south-korea-export-value-of-kdramas-by-type-of-broadcast/
Statista. (2024, February 13). Global streaming services traffic volume 2020. Statista; Laura Ceci. https://www.statista.com/statistics/187011/svod-video-platforms-traffic/

title: Final Project
section: 2. Streaming Services Like Netflix Are Crucial for Outreach
text:
2. Streaming Services Like Netflix Are Crucial for Outreach
Speaking of Netflix, the channels in which dramas are aired on play a crucial role in determining the amount of viewership dramas receive, and the outreach they have to global audiences.
In particular, global channels, mainly streaming services like Netflix, Amazon Prime, Disney+, and Hulu (Statista, 2024), give audiences convenient access to international content, easily introducing new titles and dramas to them.
Find out how common the channel you use to watch K-Dramas is among global audiences here!
 
Among the global streaming services-giant, Netflix is a clear winner in terms of the market share, garnering the most users who rely on their service to access dramas.
This suggests that dramas which are either produced, distributed, or aired by Netflix is likely able to tap into a greater audience pool, have greater outreach, and enjoy bolstered viewership.



Netflix | source: Pixabay


Let’s take a look at the distribution of dramas on global channels like Amazon, Disney+, Hulu, and Netflix!









Let’s address the part of the graph that probably caught your eye first - the extremely long orange bar under the “Netflix” category, on the x-axis.
At one glance, we can see that among the global channels, K-Dramas utilise Netflix the most to distribute its dramas, with the highest count of 130 dramas uploaded there, as compared to 31 for Japanese, and 13 for Thai. That’s significantly more than the other dramas!
Moreover, K-Dramas have the most number of dramas in total (163) that are distributed on global channels, as compared to Japanese dramas with a close number of 112, and Thai with an almost negligible count of 15.
Given Netflix’s dominance in the streaming service industry, Korea is able to leverage the channel’s extensive connections with audiences from all over the world, bolstering its market outreach by making its dramas more accessible to potential global audiences.
Combined with the sheer quantity of dramas that Korea is distributing on global channels that audiences frequently use to access international content, it reflects Korea’s deliberate strategy of going beyond the South Korean market, and instead targeting and supplying international markets with content.
It is no wonder why K-Dramas manages to achieve high global viewership and outreach to international audiences - a great strategy indeed!
